alert.note: Alert for Hamlin (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 3:56PM MDT until May 16 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota... Big Sioux River Near Castlewood affecting Hamlin County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Big Sioux River Near Castlewood. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, The roads on both sides of the river are overtopped. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:45 PM CDT Saturday was 9.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.9 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued late Sunday night by 100 AM CDT.
